text: [Music]
hello my name is Keith Brooks business
development manager for AWS cloud us
Amazon's isolated community cloud region
and today we're going to sleep some time
talking about
ITAR compliance on the AWS cloud
specifically the restrictions that
pertain to storing and processing data
in the AWS gov cloud us region
collectively these restrictions are
referred to as the ITAR boundary and
we'll discuss that in detail in a second
but first let's recap ITAR ITAR is the
International traffic and arms
regulation a US government law that
regulates the import and export of
defense articles as defined by the US
munitions lists there are 21 categories
of articles on the US munitions list and
they cover things across categories like
components materials equipment and even
software and technical information to
give you some real examples of items
that are on the US munitions list it
covers things like spacecraft aircraft
rockets and missiles weapons nuclear
data and information and technology as
well as technical data a keeper vision
for ITAR is that ITAR articles can only
be accessed by US persons and more
specifically have to be safeguarded for
foreign nationals and foreign nations
this is particularly important when it
comes to hosting ITAR workloads on the
cloud this is exactly where AWS cloud
comes into play because gov cloud was
purpose-built to host ITAR data in the
cloud however even though gov cloud is
our client region there are still
restrictions that apply to each service
available in Buffalo and as previously
mentioned these restrictions are
codified in the ITAR boundary for each
service and the ITAR boundary very
specifically describes where our data is
permitted and where our data is not
permitted within each service available
in Buffalo but let's use a real example
to illustrate this so we're going to use
for common services that are available
in the Gulf allowed region
let's look at easy to s3
EBS and RDS and I'm going to illustrate
the ITAR boundary for each of these
services using examples of what's
permitted in what's not permitted the
caveat to this is that the full list is
available in the official ITAR boundary
documentation available on the gov cloud
users go
but for easy to ITAR data is permitted
within the ec2 instance and any
ephemeral drawers associated with that
ec2 instance as well as key pairs when
using HTTPS along those same lines ITAR
data is not permitted within ec2
metadata or key pairs when using HTTP
looking at the s3 service height or data
is permitted within s3 buckets however
ITAR data is not permitted within s3
metadata or s3 resource tags same thing
applies to the EBS service ITAR data is
permitted within the EBS volume however
ITAR data is not permitted within EBS
metadata EBS volume names and EBS
snapshot names
let's look at the RDS service similar
concept applies height our data is
permitted within the RDS database
instance itself however ITAR data is not
permitted within RDS metadata RDS
snapshot names for our es resource tags
collectively what's permitted and not
permitted for each of the service is
defined as the ITAR Valerie and the ITAR
boundary is an extension of the AWS
share responsibility model which is a
key set of input to architecting and
operating ITAR workloads on the areas
cloud the full set of ITAR boundaries
can be found on the ABS gov cloud users
guide specifically within the services
available in the ADA visco cloud us
regions section the users guide can be
found on our ADA Bisco cloud home page
at AWS amazon.com port slash gov - us
and in addition to the user's guide you
can reference our complete compliance
documentation on it-- are available at
aws.amazon.com
ford slash compliant thank you for your
time today and have a great day
you
[Music]
